info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF SCREVEN...HAMPTON AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 350 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gifford to Captolo, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Allendale, Sylvania, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Estill, Fairfax, Brunson, Gifford, Newington, Furman, Scotia, Sycamore, Luray and Captolo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
